description:
The setting is Taisho era Japan. Tanjirou is a kindhearted young boy who lived peacefully with his family as a coal seller. Their normal life changes completely when his family is slaughtered by demons. The only other survivor, Tanjirou's younger sister Nezuko, has become a ferocious demon. In order to return Nezuko to normal and get revenge on the demon that killed their family, the two of them depart on a journey. From a young talent, an adventure tale of blood and swords begins!

(Source: Shonen Jump)

Notes:
- Includes 2 extra chapters.
- Nominated to the 24th and 25th Annual Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize.
synonyms: ดาบพิฆาตอสูร

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Oiran
tags.description: Prominently features a courtesan character of the Japanese Edo Period.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Polyamorous
tags.description: Features a character who is in a consenting relationship with multiple people at one time.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

node.description: Author of Kimetsu no Yaiba and Haeniwa no Zigzag. On February 2021, Gotouge was selected for the TIME 100 Next list, making it the first time a mangaka appears on the list.
Arnaud Takahashi is a French translator working for Panini Manga.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yozudami)

Mizuki Yoda graduated from the Tokyo Designer Gakuin Manga Department. At the age of 19, they received the Honorable Mention and Grand Treasure Award in the 91st Jump Treasure Newcomer Manga Award (January 2015) for the work "Jigoku no Sata mo Ryuu Shidai". The judge for the award was [Takeshi Obata](https://anilist.co/staff/96888/Takeshi-Obata). It was published in Jump Next #3 (Shueisha) in 2015, marking her debut.
Former assistant of [Yuukou Osada](https://anilist.co/staff/98848/Yuukou-Osada), [Koyoharu Gotouge](https://anilist.co/staff/119973/Koyoharu-Gotouge) and [Gege Akutami](https://anilist.co/staff/125415/Gege-Akutami).
